context_of_use: This use case allows administrators to manage user accounts and access rights within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Control system access through user account management.
description: Allow administrators to create, update, deactivate, and manage user accounts and access rights.
triggering_event: Admin requests to manage user accounts.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to manage user accounts.
postconditions: User accounts are successfully created, updated, or deactivated as per admin actions.
assumptions: The admin has the required permissions to perform user management tasks.
The system is operational and accessible.
requirements_met: The system shall allow administrators to create user accounts.
The system shall allow administrators to update user account information.
The system shall allow administrators to deactivate user accounts.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific permissions required for different user management actions.
main_flow: 1. Admin requests to manage user accounts → System displays user management interface.
2. Admin selects to create, update, or deactivate a user account → System processes the request.
3. System confirms the action taken on the user account → Admin receives confirmation of the successful action.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the admin lacks permissions, the system displays an error message indicating insufficient permissions.
information_for_steps: 2. User account details for creation or updates.
